article.description: Ben Hansbrough scored 22 points and Tim Abromaitis added 21 points, 10 rebounds and seven assists to lead Notre Dame to an easy 102-62 victory over Chicago State on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Balanced Notre Dame rolls over Chicago State
article.linkText: Balanced Notre Dame rolls over Chicago State
article.story: SOUTH BEND, Ind. -- Ben Hansbrough scored 22 points and Tim Abromaitis added 21 points, 10 rebounds and seven assists to lead Notre Dame to an easy 102-62 victory over Chicago State on Wednesday night. All five Irish starters scored in double figures. Tyrone Nash also flirted with a triple-double for Notre Dame (3-0) with 11 points, 10 rebounds and seven assists, and Carleton Scott chipped in 17 points. The Irish dominated the boards 59-28 and held Chicago State (1-2) to 34 percent shooting. The Cougars were led by Christian Wall, Carl Montgomery and Hajji Martin, who each scored 14 points. Notre Dame was just 2-for-10 from 3-point range to start the game before Hansbrough's 3 with 6:39 left in the first half. That was part of a 22-2 Irish run that turned a tie game into a 20-point Notre Dame lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
